byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and LAURIE GOODSTEIN

abstract: Conservative leaders are beating hasty retreat from religious freedom laws in Arkansas and Indiana amid backlash over their implications for gay civil rights; concessions have left Christian leaders unsettled and uncertain about future of laws that had been embraced as conservative answer to rapidly shifting national views on gay marriage and similar issues.
lead_paragraph: After Indiana changed what was billed as a religious freedom law to say it would not authorize discrimination, Christian conservatives lamented the setback to their cause.

headline.main: Religion Laws Quickly Fall Into Retreat in Indiana and Arkansas
headline.print_headline: Religion Laws Quickly Fall Into Retreat

snippet: After Indiana changed what was billed as a religious freedom law to say it would not authorize discrimination, Christian conservatives lamented the setback to their cause.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
